needs.description: Over 200,000 people displaced in Mandalay Region since the 2021 coup, with 50,000 newly displaced by intensified fighting in Sagaing and Magway in late 2025. Many are sheltering in monasteries and schools.
UN reports 1,200+ civilian casualties from airstrikes and artillery in Mandalay Region since January 2025, with 300+ children killed or injured. Arbitrary detentions continue at 15+ locations.
UNICEF estimates 40% of displaced in Mandalay lack access to safe water, with 60% lacking adequate sanitation. Cholera outbreaks reported in 3 displacement sites in January 2026.

needs.description: Kachin State hosts 100,000+ IDPs, with 20,000 newly displaced by clashes in Hpakant and Mohnyin townships in late 2025. Many are in overcrowded camps with limited services.
IPC data shows 300,000 people in Kachin State in Crisis (IPC Phase 3) or worse, with food prices up 25% since mid-2025 due to conflict and border closures.
WHO reports only 50% of health facilities in Kachin operational, with maternal mortality rising 30% since 2024 due to lack of skilled birth attendants and supplies.

needs.description: Kayah State has 150,000 IDPs, with 40,000 in Loikaw area alone after repeated attacks on villages in 2025. Overcrowding in churches and schools is severe.
OHCHR documents 500+ cases of gender-based violence in Kayah State since January 2025, with only 2 operational safe houses for survivors.
IPC analysis shows 200,000 people in Kayah State in Crisis (IPC Phase 3) or worse, with 30,000 in Emergency (IPC Phase 4) due to loss of livelihoods and market access.

needs.description: Karen State hosts 120,000 IDPs, with 25,000 in Hpa-An area after clashes in Myawaddy and Kawkareik in late 2025. Many are in makeshift shelters along the Thai border.
WHO reports a 50% increase in dengue cases in Karen State in 2025, with 8,000 cases and 40 deaths, straining under-resourced health facilities.
UNICEF estimates 60% of schools in Karen State are closed due to conflict, affecting 150,000 children. Only 10% of displaced children have access to temporary learning spaces.

needs.description: Shan State has 300,000 IDPs, with 50,000 in Taunggyi area after intensified fighting in northern and southern Shan in 2025. Many are in monasteries and community centers.
IPC data shows 500,000 people in Shan State in Crisis (IPC Phase 3) or worse, with 80,000 in Emergency (IPC Phase 4) due to conflict, crop destruction, and market disruptions.
UNICEF estimates 50% of displaced in Shan lack access to safe water, with 70% lacking adequate sanitation. Open defecation reported in 5 displacement sites.
